title.narrative: Improve food access to reduce acute humanitarian needs through restocking of families among the most vulnerable Peri-urban and IDPs in food crisis in Qardo district of Bari region

description.narrative: QRCS under the title: Improve food access to reduce acute humanitarian needs through restocking of families among the most vulnerable Peri-urban and IDPs in food crisis in Bari region will undertake activities such as: Selection of 200 drought affected households of vulnerable community of peri-urban and IDPs chosen through registering families/HHs with malnourished children who have been discharged from the nutrition sites to also benefit from the food security project in Qardo Districts of Bari regions and a total of 1200 people will benefit from the program at the district level as well as elders representing all sectors of community on the purpose of the project Selection of a local trustful traders/vendors through bid for Qardo district and MoUs signed and providers paid Distribution of vouchers having the specification and number of goats for 200 HHs i.e 2000 goats (9 lactating, one male) with a total beneficiary of 1200 individuals from the vulnerable communities in Qardo Districts of Bari, region (180 men, 540 women, Boys 240 and Girls 240), in addition provide supplements blocks 10 KG per HH, vaccinate against PPR/SGP and deworm and also Provide cash-plus to target families for 3 months Strengthen the monitoring and evaluation activities in order to optimize the project implementation. The overall goal of this emergency project is to provide lifesaving assistance to 200 most affected households in Peri-urban and IDPs integrated into host communities in food crisis in Qardo district of Bari region of Somalia through provision of restocking vouchers. To improve food accessibility to 1200 beneficiaries (boys, girls, men and women of per-urban and IDPs) in Livelihood crisis in Qardo District of Bari region to prevent death due to starvation. The voucher is based on average household size of 6 people. The voucher system is the only way to proper targeting the beneficiaries since, the goats will be given to those individuals that are carrying the restocking voucher and are listed in beneficiary list which is shared with the approved vendors.
